articles.headline: What Red Ink? Wall Street Paid Hefty Bonuses
articles.snippet: Despite crippling losses in 2008, financial employees in New York collected an estimated $18.4 billion in bonuses for the year.
articles.abstract: Despite crippling losses in 2008, financial employees in New York collected an estimated $18.4 billion in bonuses for the year.
articles.lead_paragraph: By almost any measure, 2008 was a complete disaster for Wall Street  except, that is, when the bonuses arrived.

articles.headline: House Passes Stimulus Plan With No G.O.P. Votes
articles.snippet: President Obama won House approval for an $819 billion economic plan without a single vote from Republicans as Democrats sought to temper their own differences.
articles.abstract: President Obama won House approval for an $819 billion economic plan without a single vote from Republicans as Democrats sought to temper their own differences.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Without a single Republican vote, President Obama won House approval on Wednesday for an $819 billion economic recovery plan as Congressional Democrats sought to temper their own differences over the enormous package of tax cuts and spending.

articles.headline: Awash in a Stream of Movies
articles.snippet: Netflix is cracking the technology code on Internet downloads to find the ultimate film delivery system.
articles.abstract: Netflix is cracking the technology code on Internet downloads to find the ultimate film delivery system.
articles.lead_paragraph: Any movie, any time. Is that too much to ask?

articles.headline: YouTube Said to Be Near Hollywood Deal
articles.snippet: The deal between YouTube and the William Morris Agency would place the company’s clients in made-for-the-Web productions.
articles.abstract: The deal between YouTube and the William Morris Agency would place the company’s clients in made-for-the-Web productions.
articles.lead_paragraph: YouTube and the William Morris Agency, the Hollywood talent agency, are close to signing a deal that would place the company’s clients in made-for-the-Web productions.

articles.headline: Putin’s Grasp of Energy Drives Russian Agenda
articles.snippet: Vladimir V. Putin has long built his strategy for the rebirth of Russia around the export of natural resources.
articles.abstract: Vladimir V. Putin has long built his strategy for the rebirth of Russia around the export of natural resources.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW  The titans of Russia’s energy industry gathered around an enormous map showing the route of a proposed new pipeline in Siberia. It would cost billions and had been years in the planning. After listening to their presentation, President Vladimir V. Putin frowned, got up from his chair, whipped out a felt pen and redrew the map right in front of the embarrassed executives, who quickly agreed that he was right.

articles.headline: Corporations, Tending to a Tattered Image, Clip Wings of Private Jets
articles.snippet: The prices of private jets are falling faster than the value of McMansions as many companies sell their planes to save money and avoid bad publicity.
articles.abstract: The prices of private jets are falling faster than the value of McMansions as many companies sell their planes to save money and avoid bad publicity.
articles.lead_paragraph: What’s not to like about a private jet? These days, plenty.
articles.byline: By Geraldine Fabrikant and Leslie Wayne

articles.headline: White House Unbuttons Formal Dress Code
articles.snippet: Pictures of a jacketless President Obama at the White House last week may signal a discreet culture shift.
articles.abstract: Pictures of a jacketless President Obama at the White House last week may signal a discreet culture shift.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The capital flew into a bit of a tizzy when, on his first full day in the White House, President Obama was photographed in the Oval Office without his suit jacket. There was, however, a logical explanation: Mr. Obama, who hates the cold, had cranked up the thermostat.

articles.headline: Geithner Says Plan for Banks Is in the Works
articles.snippet: The Treasury secretary said the administration is working on a comprehensive plan to “repair the financial system,” but declined to provide any specific details.
articles.abstract: The Treasury secretary said the administration is working on a comprehensive plan to “repair the financial system,” but declined to provide any specific details.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  As lawmakers pressed the Obama administration for details of how it would assist financial firms that have been rapidly deteriorating, Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner said Wednesday the administration is working on a comprehensive plan to “repair the financial system.”
articles.byline: By Stephen Labaton and Edmund L. Andrews

articles.headline: Components of Stimulus Vary in Speed and Efficiency
articles.snippet: The impact of the stimulus package will be felt within weeks once the final version becomes law, but estimating its effectiveness is far more complex.
articles.abstract: The impact of the stimulus package will be felt within weeks once the final version becomes law, but estimating its effectiveness is far more complex.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  At first, it will trickle into paychecks in small, barely perceptible amounts: perhaps $12 or $13 a week for many American workers, in the form of lower tax withholding.

articles.headline: JPMorgan Exited Madoff-Linked Funds Last Fall
articles.snippet: Investors are criticizing JPMorgan Chase for not sharing its concerns about funds tied to Bernard L. Madoff.
articles.abstract: Investors are criticizing JPMorgan Chase for not sharing its concerns about funds tied to Bernard L. Madoff.
articles.lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase says that its potential losses related to Bernard L. Madoff, the man accused of engineering an immense global Ponzi scheme, are “pretty close to zero.” But what some angry European investors want to know is when the bank cut its exposure to Mr. Madoff  and why.
articles.byline: By Claudio Gatti and Diana B. Henriques
